required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Sub-study of BMS-986036 in Subjects With Non-Alcoholic Steatohepatitis (NASH)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group, Multiple Dose Sub-study to Evaluate the Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamic Effects of BMS-986036 in Adults With Non-alcoholic Steatohepatitis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this sub-study of MB130-045 is to determine the pharmacokinetic effects, pharmacodynamic effects, efficacy and safety of BMS-986036 20 mg QD in subjects with Non-alcoholic Steatohepatitis (NASH)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Percent Hepatic Fat Fraction (%) by Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) From Baseline to Week 16
primary_outcome.description: The mean change in percent hepatic fat fraction (%) by MRI from baseline to Week 16 was assessed for each arm. A longitudinal repeated measures analysis was used to analyze the change in hepatic fat fraction (%) at Week 16 from baseline in the treated population who have both a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to date of last dose plus 30 days
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants with on-study AEs was reported for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to date of last dose plus 30 days
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants with on-study SAEs was reported for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Injection Site Reactions
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to date of last dose plus 30 days
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants with on-study injection site reactions was reported for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events Leading to Discontinuation
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to date of last dose plus 30 days
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants with on-study AEs leading to discontinuation was reported for each arm.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to date of last dose plus 30 days
primary_outcome.description: The number of deaths was reported for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Marked Laboratory Abnormalities
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to date of last dose plus 30 days
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants whose worst toxicity grade increased from baseline to grade 3 or 4 (Toxicity Scale: DAIDS Version 1.0) is reported for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Vital Sign Abnormalities
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to date of last dose plus 30 days
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants with out-of-range vital signs noted during interim or final vital sign assessments was reported for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to date of last dose plus 30 days
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants with out-of-range ECG intervals observed during interim or final electrocardiogram assessments was reported for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Physical Examination Abnormalities
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to date of last dose plus 30 days
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants with abnormalities observed during interim or final physical examination assessments is reported for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Percent Change From Baseline in Bone Mineral Density by Dual Energy X-Ray Absorptiometry (DXA)
primary_outcome.description: The mean percent change in bone mineral density from baseline to day 112 reported for each arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Trough Observed Plasma Concentration (Ctrough) of BMS-986036 at Day 112
secondary_outcome.description: The observed serum concentration of BMS-986036 before the next dose is administered (pre-dose concentration) was assessed for both C-terminal intact and total molecule. Geometric means are presented for each arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Positive Anti-BMS-986036 Antibody (ADA) Response at Day 142
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were monitored for antibodies to study medication using a validated ADA homogenous bridge assay with BMS-986036 and electrochemical luminescence detection. The number of treated participants with positive Anti-BMS-986036 antibody titers up to Day 142 with regards to baseline was reported for each arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Positive Anti-FGF21 Antibody Response at Day 142
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were monitored for antibodies to FGF21 using a validated homogenous bridge assay with Met-FGF21 (recombinant produced) and electrochemical luminescence detection. The number of treated participants with positive Anti-FGF21 antibody titers up to Day 142 with regards to baseline was reported for each arm.

arm_group.description: Administered as specified on specified days
Administered as specified on specified days

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding BMS clinical trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female between 21 and 75 years old
- Body Mass Index (BMI) of 25 or more
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic Liver disease other than NASH
- Uncontrolled diabetes
- Any major surgery within 6 weeks of screening
- Unable to self-administer under the skin injections
- Any bone trauma, fracture or bone surgery within 8 weeks of screening

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 3 participants were enrolled, randomized and treated within this sub-study (PK cohort). Note: parent study is NCT02413372 (MB130-045).

group.title: BMS-986036 20 mg QD
group.description: Participants self-administered 20 mg subcutaneous (SC) injections of BMS-986036, once daily (QD), for 16 weeks in a double-blind, outpatient setting

group.title: Placebo 20 mg QD
group.description: Participants self-administered SC injections of placebo, once daily, for 16 weeks in a double-blind, outpatient setting.

group.description: Participants self-administered 20 mg subcutaneous (SC) injections of BMS-986036, once daily (QD), for 16 weeks in a double-blind, outpatient setting

group.description: Participants self-administered SC injections of placebo, once daily, for 16 weeks in a double-blind, outpatient setting.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.description: The observed serum concentration of BMS-986036 before the next dose is administered (pre-dose concentration) was assessed for both C-terminal intact and total molecule. Geometric means are presented for each arm.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Positive Anti-BMS-986036 Antibody (ADA) Response at Day 142
outcome.description: Participants were monitored for antibodies to study medication using a validated ADA homogenous bridge assay with BMS-986036 and electrochemical luminescence detection. The number of treated participants with positive Anti-BMS-986036 antibody titers up to Day 142 with regards to baseline was reported for each arm.
outcome.population: All treated participants Note: data not reported due to privacy reasons

reported_events.time_frame: Non-serious adverse events after first dose of study medication and within 7 days of last dose and serious adverse events after first dose of study medication and within 30 days of last dose (approximately 4 months).
reported_events.desc: data not reported due to privacy reasons

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period 60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
